channel.title: Making it so you need a certain level to do a command
channel.description:
Example
If you type ::fun it would say YOU NEED AT LEAST LEVEL 99 ATTACK TO DO THIS COMMAND if you have level 99 it would give, rune helmet (just a stupid example)
How could i do this?

item.title: Making it so you need a certain level to do a command
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.source: Making it so you need a certain level to do a command

item.title: Making it so you need a certain level to do a command
item.dc:creator: @messing_with_java messing with java
item.description:
@messing_with_java wrote:

ok the else at the start remove that… none of my commands on any of my servers have that

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“magic”))
{
if (playerLevel[0] >= 135) {
{
sendMessage(“Nice Mage!”);
}
if (playerLevel[0] <= 135) {
{
sendMessage(“Shitty mage!”);
}
}

Read full topic
item.source: Making it so you need a certain level to do a command

item.title: Making it so you need a certain level to do a command
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

um idk if u resolved this yet but i c the problem at first glance… wat to many brackets…

   else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("magic"))
     {
     if (playerLevel[0] >= 135) { 
     sendMessage("Nice Mage!");
     }
     else if (playerLevel[0] <= 135)
   {
      sendMessage("Shitty mage!");
   }
      }

a nd the first example, he had a ( instead of a { so thats y it didnt work if u change it to mine and still get errors, then try removing the else from the part were it sais else if (command… because if u have that else and you dont need it, u get tons of errors

if (command.startsWith(“fun”)) {
if (playerLevel[0] >= 99) {
addItem(id, 1);
}
else (
sendMessage(“YOU NEED AT LEAST LEVEL 99 ATTACK TO DO THIS COMMAND”);
}}
